metadata.Title: CVE-2018-3750 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The utilities function in all versions <= 0.5.0 of the deep-extend node module can be tricked into modifying the prototype of Object when the attacker can control part of the structure passed to this function. This can let an attacker add or modify existing properties that will exist on all objects.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-3750` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

node-deep-extend - 0.4.1-3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: node-deep-extend package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.4.1-3').
